tldr: The author examines the histology of Hydra fusca, focusing on the structure and function of its cells, including the ectoderm, muscular layer, and endoderm. They discuss the role of interstitial cells, the presence of nematocysts in the endoderm, and the process of digestion within the organism. The study provides insights into the cellular structure and function of this simple organism, which can inform our understanding of more complex life forms.
